pyproct.driver.handlers.matrix.euclideanDistanceMatrixBuilder module¶

Created on 13/02/2013

@author: victor

class pyproct.driver.handlers.matrix.euclideanDistanceMatrixBuilder.EuclideanDistanceMatrixBuilder[source]¶

Bases: object

classmethod build(trajectory_handler, matrix_creation_parameters)[source]¶

Will generate the CondensedMatrix filled with the all vs all geometric center distances of the “body_selection” coordinates (which will usually be a ligand).

@param trajectory_handler: The handler containing selection strings, pdb info and coordsets. @param matrix_creation_parameters: The creation parameters (from the initial script).

@return: The created distances matrix.

classmethod calculate_geom_center(coordinates)[source]¶

Generates a condensed matrix with the euclidean distances between the geometrical centers of the conformations passed as input.

@param coordinates: Coordinates set from which calculating the geometrical centers (one geometrical center per conformation).

@return: The contents of the condensed matrix resulting of calculating all euclidean distances between the aforemetioned centers.

check_matrix_calculated_error()[source]¶

Exits the program if the matrix wasn’t calculated yet.

create_matrix(trajectory_handler)[source]¶

Generates a matrix with the method used in the handler creation.

@param matrix_base_path: @param parameters:

@return: The created matrix.

save_matrix(matrix_path)[source]¶

Writes matrix contents to disk.

@param matrix_save_file: Complete path (with filename) where to save the matrix.

save_statistics(matrix_base_path)[source]¶

Writes matrix statistics to disk in JSON format.

@param matrix_base_path: The folder where to save the ‘statistics.json’ file.
